intro: Roezliella malleifera, commonly known as the sticky-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves that exude a sticky substance when touched. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and sandy soils. Roezliella malleifera is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
